theLIBERTARIAN

I admit I thought Iraq did have WMD. Now it looks like they don't according to President Bush's National Security Adviser, Condoleezza Rice. Quote from the article:
 
 "President Bush's National Security Adviser, Condoleezza Rice, is now acknowledging that Iraq's weapons of mass destruction program is far less clear-cut and probably more difficult to establish than the White House portrayed before the war."
 
 http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2003/04/30/1051381996322.html
 
 I admit I was duped. I was wrong but I will be more skeptical when the government tells me something.

oh, i forgot, when you want to see who is the "bad said" and who is the "good side", then look toward the side that has much to benifit. did iraq benifit from this war? i don;t think so. did the usa have anything to benifit fromt his war? hell yes. oil and a lot fo it!
theLIBERTARIAN

The only reason I believed we should go to war was self-defense. I had thought at first that Saddam was going to supply terrorist with WMD to strike us. Well, the terrorist striking us part was quickly dispelled. So I was against the war.
 
 Then of course the reason shifted to Iraqi Freedom, which I believe is the worst reason. Now, icing on the cake, the administration admits that Iraq did not have these stockpiles let alone have capability for WMD. We still might find chemicals that if mixed together could be poisonous, but we were all misled according to Rice, period.

Originally posted by theLIBERTARIAN 
 I admit I thought Iraq did have WMD. Now it looks like they don't according to President Bush's National Security Adviser, Condoleezza Rice. Quote from the article:
 
 "President Bush's National Security Adviser, Condoleezza Rice, is now acknowledging that Iraq's weapons of mass destruction program is far less clear-cut and probably more difficult to establish than the White House portrayed before the war."
 
 http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2003/04/30/1051381996322.html
 
 I admit I was duped. I was wrong but I will be more skeptical when the government tells me something. 
 
 
 There were plenty of reasons to wage this war. I have to agree that the advertisment to wage this war and the reasons to wage the war were two different things.
 
 1) Al Queda was there in the north training. Show no mercy for the Al Queda, no matter where they are.
 2) Failure to abide by UN resolutions for 12 years is reason enough.
 3) Humanitarian reasons is a strong moral argument, but what about other parts of the world?
 4) There were enough suspicious WMD activities documented by the UN. If your GW Bush do you gamble that they are not there or gamble that they are there? Then go back and read reason #1.

 I thought we would have found the WMD.
 
 I will agree that if Saddam was going to share WMD with terrorists we should have taken him out. It is doubtful that he would have though, it would have been political suicide. Iraq was the only non-secular country left in the Arab world, now it is possible they will vote in extremist rulers. 
 
 Kevin, personally I would have us out of the UN and never had followed the UN sanctions against Iraq. I wouldn't have given taxpayer money to any country including Israel. 9-11 was a result of US government meddling over the decades.
 
 Thanks for posting Kevin.
